DOC.brief_summary: The increase risk contrast-induced nephropathy ( CIN ) patient chronic kidney disease ( CKD ) undergo coronary angiography ( CAG ) establish . Current historical data CIN prevention strategy show wide variation respect optimal type , route timing therapy . We investigate role oral hydration and/or oral sodium bicarbonate administration compare intravenous hydration and/or sodium bicarbonate patient CKD undergo CAG .
DOC.brief_title: Oral Versus Intravenous Hydration Prevent Contrast Induced Nephropathy
DOC.detailed_description: This single center study randomize patient CKD undergo CAG 4 group : 1 ) Intravenous normal saline , 2 ) Intravenous normal saline intravenous bicarbonate , 3 ) oral hydration , 4 ) oral hydration oral bicarbonate . The primary endpoint occurrence contrast-medium-induced nephropathy define great 25 % increase serum creatinine baseline absolute increase 0.5 mg/dL baseline 72 hour follow exposure radiocontrast . Secondary endpoint include length hospitalization in-house mortality .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Stable serum creatinine level least 1.1 mg/dL estimate creatinine clearance le 60 mL/min 2 . Scheduled diagnostic , elective cardiac angiography 1 . Serum creatinine level > 8.0 mg/dL 2 . Change serum creatinine level least 0.5 mg/dL previous 24 hour 3 . Preexisting dialysis 4 . Multiple myeloma myeloproliferative disease 5 . Current CHF recent history flash pulmonary edema 6 . Current myocardial infarction 7 . Symptomatic hypokalemia 8 . Uncontrolled hypertension ( treat systolic blood pressure > 200 mmHg diastolic blood pressure > 100mmHg ) 9 . Exposure radiocontrast within 7 day study 10 . Emergency Catheterization 11 . Allergy radiographic contrast 12 . Pregnancy 13 . Administration dopamine , mannitol , fenoldapam , Nacetylcysteine time study 14 . Severe COPD 15 . Serum Bicarb > 28 16 . Sodium < 133
